726258f-a.text:
Broadway, north side, east from Elmhurst to Whitney Avenues. At the latter avenue is the Long Island Railroad trestle.
P. L. Sperr  April 25, 1936

726529f-a.text:
20 Elmhurst Avenue, adjoining the NW. corner of Broadway, showing an old mansion. According to Mr. Beecher the house was built by Samuel Lord of Lord and Taylor, fashionable New York department store, as a wedding gift for his daughter Elizabeth (Mrs. Warren) and was known as the "Lord House' and the "Warren House." It has also been known as the "Combes House" for many years, after Dr. Combes.
Gift of Beecher Ogden  1941
